hilbert-fixed-points.commenet: Layered Hilbert proof stack for guardrail middle phase

lemma.statement: Sequence x_{k+1} = Π_syn(x_k) defined in layers.xml is Fejér monotone with respect to C.

proof.step: Π_syn equals P_pol P_obs restricted to H_syn.
Both P_pol and P_obs are firmly nonexpansive (hilbert.xml).
Composition of firmly nonexpansive operators with commuting property remains Fejér monotone.

lemma.statement: For penalty φ capturing invariant violations, prox_{φ} composed with T yields contraction on C.

proof.step: prox_{φ} = J_{∂φ} is firmly nonexpansive (operators.xml in hilbert folder).
Therefore prox_{φ} ∘ T is contraction with constant ≤ L.

theorem.statement: Guardrails-middle pipeline admits unique fixed point x*∈C satisfying x* = G(x*) and Π_syn(x*) = x*.

proof.step: From lemma reslovent, G is contraction on closed convex C.
Banach fixed-point theorem (spaces.xml) ⇒ unique fixed point x*.
Fejér monotonicity (lemma fejer) ensures any Π_syn-iterated sequence converges to same x*.
Hence middle-phase is consistent with guardrails-end boundary because x*∈H_rel (layers.xml).
Contraction constant q<1 implies ‖x_{k+1} - x_k‖ ≤ q^k ‖x_1 - x_0‖.
Series bounded by geometric sum ⇒ convergent.
